metadata.title: Sweden Relocators
metadata.description: Relocate to Sweden with expert advice

hero.description: We provide comprehensive relocation and immigration support for individuals, employees, and companies, covering residence permits, housing, school placements, and integration all seamlessly managed through our secure web and mobile platform across Sweden, Denmark, and the wider Nordic region.

countrySelector.subtitle: From your home today to your home tomorrow

services.badge: Empowering your skills to relocate and succeed in the Nordics
services.title: Trusted Legal Relocation Solutions For Individuals
services.subtitle: Move To and From Sweden

business.title: Relocate for Business
business.description: We help you establish a business or franchise in Sweden with full support, including residence permit guidance. To qualify, you'll need a solid business plan, investment capital, and sufficient funds for two years.

family.title: Relocating for Family Reunification
family.description: Under Directive 2004/38/EC and Swedish national laws, EU citizens and their family members have the right to reunite and reside together in Sweden. We provide guidance throughout the reunification process to ensure compliance and a smooth relocation.

work.title: Relocating with a Work Permit
work.description: We assist you in securing a work permit in Sweden, guiding both employers and employees through every step of the process. To qualify, you'll need a valid job offer, employment contract, and compliance with salary and insurance requirements.

parents.title: Dependent Parents Relocation
parents.description: We know the importance of having your parents close. Through family reunification, we help bring dependent parents to Sweden or other Nordic countries, ensuring they receive the care and support they need.

study.title: Relocating for Study in Sweden
study.description: We support you in applying for a residence permit to pursue studies in Sweden. To qualify, you'll need admission to a recognized program, proof of financial means, and valid health insurance.

ltr.title: Relocating with LTR Permits
ltr.description: If you hold a long-term residence permit in another EU country, you may have the right to move to Sweden with your family. Family reunification rules allow eligible relatives to join you.

hero.title: About Us
hero.subtitle: Welcome To SWEDEN RELOCATORS AB
hero.description: SWEDEN RELOCATORS AB was established in 2015.

whoWeAre.label: Who We Are
whoWeAre.title: Your Trusted <blue>Relocation</blue> Partner
whoWeAre.p1: Founded in 2015, Sweden Relocators AB specializes in providing tailored relocation and mobility solutions for individuals and organizations moving to Nordic countries. We simplify the process of settling into a new country by offering comprehensive services that cater to both employers and employees. Whether you're relocating for work, education, or investment opportunities, we ensure a seamless transition with services like Destination Assistance, Global Mobility Solutions, Immigration Support, Move Management, and Property Management.
whoWeAre.p2: Our web- and app-based portal provides an innovative solution for managing relocations. Employers can oversee the progress of employee transfers, while employees can track applications, explore housing and schools, and manage expenses efficiently - all in one place.

employer.title: Employer Solutions
employer.description: We assist employers in managing the complexities of relocating their workforce. Services include:
list: Global Mobility Program Design: Tailored strategies for organization-wide compliance.
Visa and Work Permit Assistance: Expert support for streamlined immigration processes.
Move Coordination: Handling logistics, household goods shipment, and housing for employees and their families.
Cultural Integration Programs: Workshops and training to help employees adapt smoothly.

employee.title: Employee Solutions
employee.description: For individuals and their families, we provide end-to-end support to ease their transition, including:
list: Immigration Services: Assistance with visa applications and residence permits.
Housing and School Search: Access to housing options and schools based on lifestyle, budget, and preferences.
Orientation and Settling-In Support: Language courses and cultural orientation training.
Digital Relocation Tools: Real-time updates and financial management through our app and portal.

nordic.title: Nordic Relocators - Denmark
nordic.p1: Expanding our expertise across the Nordic region, Nordic Relocators offers specialized services for moving to Denmark. Whether you're relocating an entire team or a single employee, we provide tailored solutions to address Denmark's specific requirements. From visa applications to housing and cultural integration, our services are designed to ensure a successful move.
nordic.p2: At Sweden Relocators AB and Nordic Relocators, we're committed to making every relocation efficient, stress-free, and rewarding, helping both employers and employees thrive in their new Nordic environment.

student.title: Student Admission Services
student.description: Assistance in choosing the right degree program and residence permit processing for international students.

work.title: Work & Business
work.description: Assistance in registering a business, buying a new business, and preparing work permit applications for employees and employers.

family.title: Family Relocation
family.description: We provide assistance in your family visa processing including your dependent parents and other family members.

investment.title: Investment Solutions
investment.description: There are various opportunities for business ventures, look for the best opportunity to build your future.

hero.title: Contact Us
hero.subtitle: Find us at your nearest location, or reach us digitally anytime through our web and app.

formSection.title: Our Services for a Seamless <blue>Move to Sweden</blue>
formSection.heading2: We'll be glad to hear from you, buddy.

hero.badge: Clear Guidance, Right Support, Your Path Forward
hero.description: We are delivering seamless solutions for individuals and businesses within one secure platform.

hero.title: Comprehensive Guide to Work Permits in Sweden
hero.subtitle: Explore the variety of work permits available for different types of employment in Sweden, with unique requirements for each option.

intro.heading: Understanding Work Permits in Sweden
intro.description: Sweden offers a variety of work permits for different types of employment, each with unique requirements. If you're planning to work in Sweden, it's essential to understand the options available and ensure you meet the updated criteria.
intro.toolLink: Sweden Relocators offers a Work Permit Assessment Tool on our website, allowing you to quickly determine your eligibility and the best permit for your circumstances.

permitTypes.heading: Types of Work Permits in Sweden

permits.title: Standard Work Permit for Employment
permits.description: For individuals who have secured employment in Sweden

requirements.label: Job Offer
requirements.description: You must have a confirmed job offer with a Swedish employer.

requirements.label: Minimum Salary
requirements.description: Around SEK 30,000 before taxes. Must meet Swedish collective agreements or industry standards.

requirements.label: Employment Conditions
requirements.description: Must adhere to Swedish standards for health, insurance, and pension contributions.

requirements.label: Advertisement Requirement
requirements.description: Job must be advertised within EU/EEA for at least 10 days before hiring a non-EU citizen.

permits.duration: Up to 2 years, with possibility of extension

permits.title: EU Blue Card
permits.description: For highly qualified professionals with skills in demand across the EU

requirements.label: Higher Education
requirements.description: University degree or at least 5 years of relevant professional experience required.

requirements.label: Salary Threshold
requirements.description: Job offer with salary exceeding the EU Blue Card minimum threshold for Sweden.

permits.duration: Up to 4 years based on employment contract

permits.title: Seasonal Worker Permit
permits.description: For short-term seasonal work in agriculture (berry pickers and plant workers)

requirements.label: Employment Contract
requirements.description: Contract from Swedish employer for seasonal work up to 6 months.

requirements.label: Wages and Benefits
requirements.description: Must be in line with Swedish collective agreements.

requirements.label: Health Insurance
requirements.description: Must have health insurance covering the stay.

permits.duration: Duration of employment contract, typically up to 6 months

permits.title: Au Pair Permit
permits.description: For young individuals (18–30 years) living with a host family

requirements.label: Age Requirement
requirements.description: Must be between 18 and 30 years old.

requirements.label: Host Family Contract
requirements.description: Formal agreement specifying duties, working hours, and pay.

requirements.label: Language Study
requirements.description: Required to take Swedish language courses during stay.

requirements.label: Minimum Allowance
requirements.description: Host family must provide allowance meeting Sweden's au pair wage standard.

permits.title: Working Holiday Visa
permits.description: For young people from specific countries to work and travel

requirements.label: Eligible Countries
requirements.description: Australia, New Zealand, South Korea, Canada, Japan, Argentina, and others.

requirements.label: Age Requirement
requirements.description: Typically for individuals between 18 and 30 years.

requirements.label: Sufficient Funds
requirements.description: Proof of funds to support oneself initially.

permits.duration: Valid for one year with certain employment restrictions

permits.title: Self-Employment Permit
permits.description: For entrepreneurs and self-employed individuals establishing a business

requirements.label: Business Plan
requirements.description: Viable business plan demonstrating profitability within two years.

requirements.label: Sufficient Funds
requirements.description: Proof of funds to support business and personal expenses during initial phase.

requirements.label: Business Experience
requirements.description: Documented experience in running a business or industry-specific expertise.

permits.title: Sports and Cultural Worker Permit
permits.description: For individuals working in sports, arts, or cultural fields

requirements.label: Employment or Sponsorship
requirements.description: Job offer from Swedish organization within sports or culture.

requirements.label: Salary Standards
requirements.description: Wages consistent with collective agreements and Swedish standards.

permits.duration: Duration of contract with extension options

permits.title: Researcher Permit
permits.description: For researchers offered positions with accredited Swedish institutions

requirements.label: Host Agreement
requirements.description: Agreement with research institution detailing activity, funding, and conditions.

requirements.label: Project Funding
requirements.description: Financial support for the research project duration.

permits.duration: Length of research project with extension options

process.heading: Application Process and Waiting Times
process.intro: The application process and waiting times vary based on permit type, circumstances, and current Migration Agency workload.

generalRequirements.heading: General Requirements for All Work Permits
generalRequirements.description: Regardless of permit type, all applicants must meet these core requirements:

requirements.title: Valid Passport
requirements.description: Must be valid for the entire period of your intended stay.

requirements.title: Health Insurance
requirements.description: Some permits (Working Holiday, Au Pair) require health insurance coverage.

requirements.title: Clean Criminal Record
requirements.description: Serious criminal records may result in permit denial.

support.heading: How Sweden Relocators Can Assist You
support.description: Sweden Relocators provides full support for all types of work permits, ensuring a smooth and efficient process:

services.title: Eligibility Assessment
services.description: Use our Work Permit Assessment Tool to find the best permit for your circumstances.

services.title: Document Preparation
services.description: We assist in compiling employment contracts, financial statements, and health insurance proof.

services.title: Application & Tracking
services.description: We handle submission and keep you updated through each application stage.

services.title: Post-Permit Support
services.description: Housing assistance, bank account setup, and registration with Swedish authorities.

cta.heading: Start Your Work Permit Journey Today
cta.description: Contact Sweden Relocators to begin your work permit application and start your career journey in Sweden.
cta.subtext: Visit our Work Permit Section or contact us for more information.

hero.title: Swedish Citizenship: Requirements, Application Paths, and Processing Times
hero.subtitle: Becoming a Swedish citizen is a significant milestone that grants full rights and responsibilities in Sweden. Citizenship provides access to a Swedish passport, the right to vote, the ability to stand for political office, and freedom of movement across the EU and Schengen Area.

intro.heading: What Swedish Citizenship Offers
intro.description: Swedish citizenship strengthens your legal security, making it easier to live, work, and invest in Sweden permanently. It grants you not only the right to a Swedish passport but also secure legal status, EU freedom of movement, and full participation in Swedish democracy.
intro.note: Sweden Relocators provides expert guidance on every step of the process, ensuring your application is complete, accurate, and compliant with current laws.

generalRequirements.heading: General Requirements for Swedish Citizenship
generalRequirements.description: To apply for Swedish citizenship as an adult, you must generally meet the following conditions:

requirements.title: Age Requirement
requirements.description: You must be at least 18 years old to apply independently. Children under 18 can apply together with a parent or via notification in specific cases.

requirements.title: Permanent Residence or Permanent Right of Residence
requirements.description: Non-EU/EEA citizens must hold a permanent residence permit (permanent uppehållstillstånd). EU/EEA citizens must hold a permanent right of residence (permanent uppehållsrätt), usually acquired after five years of continuous legal residence.

requirements.title: Length of Residence in Sweden
requirements.description: Standard Rule: 5 years of continuous residence. Refugees or stateless persons: 4 years. Spouses/registered partners/cohabitants of Swedish citizens: 3 years. Nordic citizens: 2 years (ordinary) or 5 years (notification).

requirements.title: Good Conduct
requirements.description: Applicants must demonstrate good conduct, meaning no recent serious criminal record, no unresolved debts with Kronofogden (the Enforcement Authority), and general compliance with Swedish law.

requirements.title: Intent to Remain in Sweden
requirements.description: Migrationsverket considers whether you have strong ties to Sweden, such as employment, family, or long-term housing, showing your genuine intention to remain.

specialCategories.heading: Special Categories and Paths to Citizenship

categories.title: Nordic Citizens
categories.description: Nordic citizens (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway) benefit from the most flexible rules:
details: Ordinary Application: Eligible after 2 years of residence in Sweden.
Notification Process (anmälan): Eligible after 5 years of residence. This is a simplified procedure.

categories.title: EU/EEA Citizens
categories.description: EU/EEA citizens can apply after 5 years of continuous residence, once permanent right of residence is acquired.
details: Must show proof of residence, income, and compliance with Swedish law.
The process is slightly simpler since no residence permit is required.

categories.title: Refugees and Stateless Persons
categories.description: Recognized refugees and stateless individuals can apply after 4 years of residence.
details: Refugee status must be officially recognized under international or Swedish law.

categories.title: Spouses or Partners of Swedish Citizens
categories.description: Spouses or registered partners can apply after 3 years of residence.
details: The couple must have lived together in Sweden for at least 2 years.
Strong ties to Sweden are required, and the relationship must be ongoing.

categories.title: Children under 18
categories.description: Children can apply through simplified procedures.
details: Can apply together with a parent or through a simplified notification.
Adopted children automatically acquire Swedish citizenship if adopted before age 12.

process.heading: Application Process
process.intro: The citizenship application involves several key steps:

steps.title: Prepare Documents
steps.description: Required documents include: Valid passport or national ID, Proof of residence (registration with Skatteverket), Income or employment records, Police or debt clearance if applicable.

steps.title: Submit Application
steps.description: Applications can be submitted online via Migrationsverket's e-service or through a paper form. Children and Nordic citizens using the notification process have simplified procedures.

steps.title: Migrationsverket Review
steps.description: The Migration Agency verifies residence history, identity, conduct, and financial stability. They may request additional information during the process.

steps.title: Decision
steps.description: If approved, you receive a certificate of Swedish citizenship. If rejected, you may appeal to an administrative court.

waitingTimes.heading: Processing Times and Waiting Periods
waitingTimes.intro: Processing times vary based on category and background:

times.time: Migrationsverket recently announced stricter checks (March 2025), which may increase waiting times for certain cases.

support.heading: How Sweden Relocators Can Assist You
support.description: Applying for Swedish citizenship can be complex and time-consuming. Sweden Relocators offers professional support at every stage:

services.title: Eligibility Assessment
services.description: We check your residence history, family situation, and permit status to determine your best pathway.

services.title: Document Preparation
services.description: Ensuring accuracy, translations, and completeness to prevent delays in processing.

services.title: Application Submission and Monitoring
services.description: We manage your application and track updates directly with Migrationsverket.

services.title: Appeals Assistance
services.description: If your application is denied, our legal team helps prepare and file appeals.

services.title: Long-Term Strategy
services.description: Guidance on how to maintain residence requirements, avoid gaps, and prepare for citizenship.

cta.heading: Begin Your Path to Swedish Citizenship Today
cta.description: Contact Sweden Relocators to assess your eligibility and start your citizenship application with expert support.
cta.subtext: Swedish Citizenship Act (2001:82). Rules and processes may change. Always consult Migrationsverket for the most current information.

hero.title: Study in Sweden and the EU
hero.subtitle: Pursue your academic dreams in Europe's top universities with expert guidance from Sweden Relocators AB

intro.heading: Your Gateway to European Education
intro.description: Sweden and the European Union offer world-class education with affordable tuition, English-taught programs, and excellent post-study opportunities. Whether you aspire to study engineering in Sweden, business in Denmark, or medicine in Germany, we guide you through every step of the admission and visa process.

countries.name: Study in Sweden
countries.intro: Sweden is one of Europe's most popular destinations for international students. With globally ranked universities, innovative teaching methods, and a strong reputation for research, it offers both high-quality education and an excellent lifestyle.

fees.amount: SEK 80,000 – 295,000 (€7,500 – €25,500) depending on program and university

countries.popularFields: Engineering, IT, Business, Life Sciences, Environmental Studies

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: EU/EEA: No visa required
Non-EU/EEA: Residence permit required for studies longer than three months
Proof of funds: approx. SEK 10,300 per month for living costs
Health insurance required for stays under one year

countries.workRights: Students can work unlimited hours during studies, and after graduation can apply for a one-year post-study residence permit to find a job or start a business.

countries.name: Study in Denmark
countries.intro: Denmark combines academic excellence with a business-friendly environment. Over 500 English-taught programs are offered across leading universities and colleges.

intakes.details: Applications close in March (studies start in August/September)
Applications close in September (studies start in January/February, limited courses)

countries.popularFields: Design, Architecture, Business, Engineering, IT, Life Sciences

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Proof of funds: approx. €1,000 per month for living expenses
Health insurance must be secured before arrival

countries.workRights: Students can work up to 20 hours per week during semesters and full-time during holidays.

countries.name: Study in Germany
countries.intro: Germany is one of the most affordable and attractive study destinations in Europe, with nearly 400,000 international students.
countries.popularFields: Engineering, Business, Computer Science, Medicine, Natural Sciences

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Proof of finances: approx. €11,000 per year in a blocked account
Mandatory health insurance required

countries.workRights: 20 hours per week during semester, full-time during breaks.

countries.name: Study in the United Kingdom
countries.intro: The UK is home to some of the world's top universities and an internationally recognized degree system.
countries.popularFields: Law, Business, Engineering, Medicine, Social Sciences

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Student visa required for non-EU/EEA
Proof of tuition paid plus €1,200 per month (London) or lower outside London

countries.workRights: 20 hours per week during term, full-time during vacations.

countries.name: Study in Latvia
countries.intro: Latvia provides affordable education and peaceful living conditions.

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Student visa and proof of living expenses required
Health insurance mandatory

countries.name: Study in Lithuania
countries.intro: Lithuania offers strong academic traditions and over 350 English-taught programs.

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Residence permit required for non-EU students
Financial proof and insurance needed

countries.name: Study in Czech Republic
countries.intro: The Czech Republic is a growing destination for international students in Central Europe.

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Student visa required for non-EU students
Proof of finances and accommodation must be shown

countries.name: Study in Norway
countries.intro: Norway is known for tuition-free education at public universities.
countries.popularFields: Energy, Marine Sciences, Engineering, IT, Natural Sciences

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Proof of approx. €12,000 per year for living costs required
Health insurance mandatory

countries.workRights: 20 hours per week during semester, full-time during holidays.

countries.name: Study in Finland
countries.intro: Finland offers modern education and a strong focus on research and innovation.

intakes.details: Secondary intake, limited programs — applications in September

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Residence permit required for non-EU students
Proof of funds: minimum €800 per month (€9,600 per year)
Health insurance required

countries.workRights: Students may work 20–25 hours per week during semesters and full-time during holidays. Post-study work permit available for graduates.

whyChoose.heading: Why Choose Sweden Relocators AB

services.title: Complete Admission Guidance
services.description: Complete admission guidance for Bachelor's, Master's, and PhD programs across Sweden and the EU

services.title: Document Services
services.description: Document attestation, translation, and preparation for universities and migration authorities

services.title: Visa and Residence Support
services.description: Visa and residence permit applications handled with precision

services.title: Financial Assistance
services.description: Scholarship and financial advice tailored to each country

services.title: Post-Study Support

whyChoose.description: At Sweden Relocators AB, we make studying in Sweden and Europe simple, transparent, and stress-free. From your first application to your graduation and beyond, we guide you every step of the way.

cta.heading: Begin Your Study Journey in Europe Today
cta.description: Contact Sweden Relocators to get expert guidance on your application and visa process.
cta.subtext: Education regulations vary by country. Always consult official university and immigration websites for the most current information.
